page.title: 06CAER CARADOC ALL STRETTON
page.content: {1 Caer Caradoc}is{1,506 feet}high. It rises very steeply to 900 feet above the valley. It is made out of volcanic and pre_cambrian rock. Some people say that{Caradoc looks {like a crouching lion.}We can see it from our classroom window. From the top of Caradoc on a clear day you can see as far as Snowdonia. It has an iron age fort on the top of it. The ditches are still very easy to see. A little way down from the top there is a small cave. People lived in the fort when the Romans were in Shropshire. There is a story that Caractacus hid there from the Roman armies. (Though local people think it was another hill near Clun) During the Second World War a bomb fell on Caradoc. It was the only one to fall in the area.
